text: Anyone with an idea about the ladders? I can’t find a logical explanation. On the normal price point ladder you can just do ladder.sort() and you’re done. Why do they make such an elaborate ladder? I’m currently in the process of creating a local state and feel like I’ve missed something. I am sure there is an explanation for the ladder.

text: Level / Depth Based Ladders has three values: level, price, size! Price point / full depth Ladders has two values: price, size! What is the point of the Level Based Ladder?

elements.text: Level / Depth Based Ladders has three values: level, price, size! Price point / full depth Ladders has two values: price, size! What is the point of the Level Based Ladder?

text: They're different fields

elements.text: They're different fields

text: (b=best available to back, atb = available to back)

text: Does the level not simply indicate the position of that entry relative to the "top" of each ladder? That is how I always read it even though I use the full price ladder. Level 0 indicates which price is current "best" price available. With the full ladder you need to calculate that top yourself. No??
